text:
That code completely crashes REPL..... 1.5.3, 1.6...
```Base.convert(String, x::Symbol) = string(x)```

Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
You probably meant to define `Base.convert(::Type{String}, x::Symbol) = string(x)` though :slightly_smiling_face:

To elaborate a little: Julia allows you to redefine Julia's own behaviour, but that means you run the risk of totally wrecking Julia by doing it. E.g. you can define what it means to add two integers, and then everything crashes

text:
> You probably meant to define
Probably, but even that is questionable and is [type piracy](<https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/manual/style-guide/#Avoid-type-piracy>).
